title: Leeuwenkuil 2015 Marsanne (Paardeberg)
description: Aromas of waxy melon, orange rind, pear flesh and white flowers set the stage on the nose of this attractive white. The palate is full yet harmonious, the ripe fruit tones balanced by ample acidity and a lingering note of citrus pith on the close. Drink now–2020.

title: Lunadoro 2013 Quercione Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of baked plum, coconut and vanilla carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with dried black cherry, dark baking spice and star anise. Close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Santa Rita  (Valtellina)
description: This opens with aromas of raspberry, violet and baking spice that carry over to the bright easygoing palate along with a touch of white pepper. Fresh acidity and velvety tannins provide supple support.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2013 Ammiraglia  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas of cedar, black currant and a hint of thyme. The juicy palate delivers blackberry jam, tobacco and a touch of truffle alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Markus Wine Co 2015 Blue Red (Lodi)
description: Warm spices and rich fruits fill up this plush, flavorful and mouth-filling wine that is 90% Zinfandel. It smells like balsam and cedar and tastes like plums and cardamom while soft tannins make it cushy on the palate yet give just a little bite to keep it appetizing.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Peau Rouge Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The nose offers slight hints of lemon and yeast, with a herbal note reminiscent of fern. The slender palate fills out with a savory note and adds white pepper to accentuate a green tinge.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Terroir B Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: An earthy hint plays on the nose before disappearing on the palate. The body is very slender, showing a high-toned freshness of lemon that pervades from start to finish. This ends wonderfully refreshing, dry and clean.

title: Megan Anne 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The 2014 was designated as Nysa vineyard; this is simply labeled Dundee Hills. Very young, almost like a barrel sample, this offers raspberry and cherry fruit backed with ample acidity and showing a touch of heat. The finish turns tangy, with a hint of interesting funk.

title: Michele Satta 2015 Rosso  (Bolgheri)
description: This blend of 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot, 10% Syrah and 10% Teroldego presents aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and green peppercorn. The aromas follow through to the bright savory palate along with a hint of cinnamon while velvety tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink through 2019 to capture the fruit and freshness.

title: Niepoort 2016 Redoma Branco White (Douro)
description: Intense, ripe and textured, this wine is strongly mineral in character. It is balanced with vibrant apple fruitiness as well as concentration from the old vines in the blend. This wine could do with another few months aging, so drink from 2019.

title: Palazzo Vecchio 2013 Terrarossa  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Delicate scents suggesting dried aromatic herb, wild berry, purple flower, leather and underbrush slowly emerge. Mirroring the nose, the firm, structured palate offers Marasca cherry, pomegranate, star anise and an earthy hint of game alongside vibrant acidity and rather grainy tannins. It has a rustic charm but it's also savory and full of personality.

title: Phelps Creek 2014 Regina Pommard Clone Selection Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: The forward and fruity Pommard clone shines brightly here, cloaked in flavors of ginger cookies and plum cake. It's spicy and front loaded, and it seems to be peaking about now. Hints of stem and astringency come up in the aftertaste. The advice from here is drink it now through 2019.

title: Phelps Creek 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: This was barrel fermented in French oak, presumably some of it new or once-used, as there is a light and pleasingly toasty frame around baked-apple flavors. It drinks like an apple pastry, with enough acid to prop it up and keep flavors lively.

title: Phelps Creek 2016 Fleur de Roy Rosé of Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: A lovely coppery hue, this is a full-bodied wine with plentiful flavors of citrus, strawberries and cherries. It broadens out in the mouth, without losing focus, and brings in a streak of sassafras. As with most rosés, it should be consumed with two years of the vintage.

title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2016 CH by Chocapalha White (Lisboa)
description: From one of the premium vineyards in the Lisboa region, this wine is made from some of the oldest vines in the estate. Its rich character and spice from wood aging are still young although they show ripe promise. Textured and mineral, it will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Quinta de la Rosa 2016 La Rosa Reserva Branco White (Douro)
description: From a blend that includes several local white grape varieties, this wood-aged wine has attractive soft fruit and a smooth texture. Touches of spice from the wood aging are well integrated with the orange and lemon-zest flavors and crisp apples. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Rainbow's End 2015 Estate Wine Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)
description: Pretty and fruit-forward, this leads with attractive aromas of ripe dark berries and bramble that are hit by a good dose of tobacco leaf and purple flowers. The palate is juicy and lush, but not overdone, with tasty plum and berry flavors that are supported by fine tannins and a spicy, oaky overlay. Drink now–2020.

title: Ricci Curbastro 2013 Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: White stone fruit, toast and bread crust aromas follow over to the vibrant palate along with yellow apple, fennel and bitter walnut. Bright acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.

title: Ricci Curbastro 2013 Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: White wild flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of nut lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the bright palate offers yellow apple, lemon zest, graphite and toasted nut alongside vibrant acidity and a lively refined mousse.

title: Rock Point 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This Pinot is forward and fruity, bursting with lush flavors of ripe plum and maraschino cherry. A thin vein of dark chocolate threads through the tannins. The length and structure suggest that this can be aged another half decade or longer.

title: Salcheto 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Pipe tobacco, wild berry and star anise aromas set the tone on this light-bodied but savory red. The bright, almost ethereal palate reflects the nose, offering Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of graphite framed in polished tannins.

title: Seacampo 2014 Casa Américo Jaen (Dão)
description: Also known as Mencia in Spain, this grape has established itself in the Dão region in Portugal. It makes a soft wine, low in acidity while rich in black fruits. It has plenty of almost-sweet fruit, ripe tannins and a rounded, smooth aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a pretty, even sexy style, that matches its crisp green apple core to lightly buttery barrel toast. It's a classic combination, well executed, not too ripe, but fresh, clean and quite tasty.

title: Talisman 2014 Starscape Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is thick in youthful tannin and earthy intrigue—an explosive, spicy and exotic expression of the variety that's all in. Wild strawberry, pine, clove and black tea intermingle with purpose and distinct power.

title: Talosa 2013 Filai Lunghi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Underbrush, chopped herb, baked plum and a whiff of new leather aromas take shape in the glass. The taut dense palate offers prune, blackberry extract and licorice framed in tightly knit close-grained tannins that give the finish a grip.

title: Talosa 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of ripe plum, cake spice and menthol make their way to the forefront. On the full-bodied palate, taut fine-grained tannins support dried black cherry, prune and mocha. Fresh acidity lifts the brooding flavors.

title: Valserrano 2016 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A nicely oaked bouquet includes aromas of tropical fruits, melon and green banana. This has a full, creamy palate, with oak resin and acidity balancing each other out. Salty melon and banana flavors are oaky, while this is texturally pleasing on the finish.

title: Vigna Dorata 2012 Satèn Millesimato  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit, bread crust and a whiff of aromatic herb float from the glass in this soft sparkler. The creamy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, white peach, toatsted hazelnut and a hint of ginger alongside a silky mousse.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Legón Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy berry aromas come with a bell-pepper note. In the mouth, this wine is raw and somewhat abrasive. Plum and raspberry flavors are lightly herbal, while this is distinctly tannic, raw and tough on the finish. This quality wine begs for food.

title: Winter's Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a block selection and the highest level effort of the winery's three Pinot Gris. Fermentation was carried out in both barrels and tanks, and that adds some welcome roundness and flesh to the midpalate. Citrus, cucumber and apple flavors come lightly touched with barrel toast. Drink now through 2021.
